baseline_groups.claim_summary: Higher share of political prisoners (enemies) in nearby 1952 Gulag camps causes higher wages in modern Russian firms, identified via within-Oblast variation using employee-weighted OLS.
baseline_groups.notes: Five baseline specs differ by control sets and sample (with/without Moscow). All use lnwage, share_enemies_1952_100, Oblast FE, WLS by employees, Gulag cluster SEs.

global_notes: 64 specs total. robust/control/none duplicates baseline. robust/estimation/no_fe flips sign (expected). Unweighted OLS yields near-zero coefficient (0.036), highlighting sensitivity to employee weighting.
